item.title: Installation
item.description: Install the Deno CLI. This is for mac. Other installation methods can be found here. curl -fsSL https://deno.land/install.sh | sh Ensure deno is available in the environment path deno --version Install vscode deno extension. Open the VS Code command palette with Ctrl+Shift+P, and run: Deno: Initialize Workspace Configuration

item.title: Create webapp directory
item.description: This will be the working directory of your web application. mkdir webapp && cd webapp Open vscode editor from the working directory code .

item.title: Create entry point file
item.description: Entrypoint # import application from "https://deno.land/x/fastro@v0.58.4/server/mod.ts"; const app = application(); app.get("/", () => "Hello world"); await app.serve(); How to run # You can run the webapp from local. deno run -A hello_world.ts Or try running a simple program from the repo. deno run -A https://deno.land/x/fastro@v0.58.4/examples/hello_world.ts Examples # You can find more examples on this page.

item.title: Deployments
item.description: deployctl is a command line tool for deploying your code to Deno Deploy, and it’s also a GitHub Action for the same purpose. You can install deployctl command with the below command: deno install --allow-read --allow-write --allow-env --allow-net --allow-run --no-check -r -f https://deno.land/x/deploy/deployctl.ts To deploy a local script: deployctl deploy --project=helloworld hello_world.ts To deploy a remote script: deployctl deploy --project=helloworld https://deno.land/x/fastro/examples/hello_world.ts
